page.title: 18Morriston Hospital
page.content: Morriston{Hospital}is a single storey building with very long corridors. There are twenty three wards and twentyeight patients in each ward. There are special wards for old people and children. The old people's wards are called geriatric wards. In the children's wards, mothers and fathers can stay all day and night. In wards ten and twelve there are women waiting to have babies and women who have just given birth. These are called maternity wards. In our class, twelve out of twenty-seven children were born in Morriston Hospital. The hospital was built forty-three years ago in 1942 for American soldiers during the Second World War.
